Alcuin squeeze into final

A strong display saw Alcuin firsts squeeze past their Halifax firsts opponents and into the College Hockey final on Sunday

Alcuin and Langwith battle for Vase final

By James Bithell

We look ahead to the Vase semi final between Alcuin thirds and Langwith seconds, both sides will be hoping to re-create their quarter final form to book a place in the final

Depleted Derwent face Halifax

We look ahead to the Plate semi final between Derwent seconds and Halifax thirds, Derwent are certainly the favourites but Halifax will be looking to cause an upset

James thirds looking for another cup upset

When James thirds stunned James firsts to secure a spot in the semi final it began one of the fairy tales of College Cup 2013. Now they'll be hoping they can see their fairytale carry on all the way to the final

Halifax hunt for win in third successive final

By James Bithell

The reaction to Halifax firsts fantastic semi final victory over Halifax seconds on the JLD on Monday

Kourvelos wonder-strike secures Plate final for postgrads

A Vasileios Kourvelos wonder-strike midway through the second half provided the only goal of this tightly-fought semi-final, which saw the postgrads progress to the Plate final ahead of a spirited Vanbrugh thirds team

Taylor the hero as Vanbrugh thirds make Plate semis

Vanbrugh thirds progressed to the semi-finals of the Plate this afternoon as James seconds crashed out on penalties, with Kallum Taylor saving two spot kicks in superb fashion

Goodricke seconds march past Halifax to make Vase semis

Goodricke seconds put in a performance of eloquence and fluidity on the JLD this afternoon to put Halifax fourths to the sword with a 5-1 victory

Penalty drama sets up all-Halifax semi final

Halifax seconds won a dramatic penalty shootout against Vanbrugh firsts in today's College Cup quarter final, setting up a clash with Halifax firsts in the last four

Halifax thirds through to Plate semis with gritty Alcuin win

Halifax thirds progressed to the semi-finals of the Plate with a tense 4-2 penalty shootout victory to send Alcuin firsts home this afternoon

Plucky Langwith see off James in Vase

A Louis Pegg free-kick five minutes before the end of the game ensured that Langwith seconds beat James fourths, to book their place in the Vase semi finals against Alcuin thirds next week

Derwent march through to semi finals as Goodricke crash out

Derwent firsts managed to squeeze through to the College Cup semi finals after defeating Goodricke firsts 1-0 on the JLD this afternoon

Derwent retain College Sports Day title

Derwent took a narrow win in College Sports Day for the second year in succession, beating James to the win thanks to their success in the tug of war

Derwent seconds sneak into Plate semi-final

Derwent seconds emerged victorious against Derwent thirds with an unspectacular performance that saw them win 1-0 to progress to the Plate semi-finals

Brough brace defeats Derwent

Two goals from George Brough and a Ben Bugeja free kick were enough to see Alcuin thirds through to the Vase semi finals at the expense of Derwent fifths

James thirds stun firsts in shootout drama

A spirited James thirds team produced the upset of the tournament to knock out College Cup giants James firsts 6-5 on penalties after the scores finished 0-0 at the end of normal time

Halifax edge past Vanbrugh to progress

Halifax firsts booked their place in the Cup semi-finals on Monday after squeezing past a spirited Vanbrugh seconds side

Dominant Langwith firsts ease into Vase semis

Langwith firsts began life in the newly created Vase with a resounding 5-2 win against Vanbrugh fourths, with front man Sam Woodall slamming home four goals to help the men from Hes East sweep past

Firsts on top in postgrad clash

Wentworth firsts booked their place in the Plate semi finals with a 7-2 win over the postgrads' second team

College Cup Group Stage Review

As the College Cup quarter finals approach, Dan Holland takes a look at how the tournament has progressed so far

Derwent secure Cup progression with win over James

Derwent firsts secured their progression through to the Cup with a stylish 3-0 win over James seconds on the JLD this afternoon

Vanbrugh edge past Halifax to top group

Vanbrugh firsts put in a professional performance against Halifax thirds to take a 2-0 victory and finish top of Group D going into the Cup quarter-finals

Goodricke seconds march into Vase with nine goal rout

Goodricke seconds finished off the group stages in imperious form, crushing a below-strength Langwith thirds side 9-0, with Joe Mann and captain Fabian Ashurst scoring hat-tricks

Halifax through to the Cup after defeating spirited Vanbrugh

Halifax seconds saw off a spirited Vanbrugh side to see them finish second in Group C and secure their progression to the Cup

Goodricke crush Wentworth to secure top spot

Goodricke firsts put nine goals, including a Dan Gorringe hat-trick, past Wentworth thirds in a 9-0 victory that saw them top Group C with consummate ease

Plate-bound Alcuin see off Langwith

A dubious Greg Fearn goal was enough for Alcuin firsts to see off a battling Langwith seconds side on the JLD this afternoon

Alcuin thirds take Vase spot

A 1-1 draw with Goodricke thirds was enough to see Alcuin thirds take fifth in Group B and a place in the Vase

Vanbrugh hold nerve in thrilling draw to go through to the Cup

In one of the matches of the tournament so far Vanbrugh seconds managed to hold their nerve in a pulsating 3-3 draw against Wentworth firsts to go through to the Cup quarter finals

York complete the double against Sheffield in brilliant end to season

York's women's cricketers defeated Sheffield University by 71 runs yesterday on 22 acres

University could be Rugby World Cup training venue

The University is involved in the bidding process to be a training venue for the 2015 Rugby World Cup
